physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Urinary vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) levels were high; an area of capsular rupture was noted upon macroscopic examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypertension and vasomotor symptoms resolved after surgery, but 8 years later, clinical and biochemical recurrence occurred with multiple nodules found.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: High urinary total metanephrine-to-creatinine ratio (UETM); an area of ruptured capsule was observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Six years post-surgery, renewed vasomotor symptoms and hypertension occurred.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: High concentration of urinary VMA (189 mg/L); surgical examination revealed difficulties due to tumor size and fragmentation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months after surgery, symptoms resolved and UETM was normal, but four years later, vasomotor symptoms recurred with elevated UETM.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI demonstrated a 25 mm pheochromocytoma with elevated UETM; ruptured capsule was noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years post-surgery, accelerated hypertension with vasomotor symptoms developed.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Gradual onset of hypertension, headaches, perspiration
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: High VMA levels; multiple areas of necrosis identified histologically.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Five months post-surgery, no evidence of tumor persistence was observed, but sixteen years later, a mass was found adjacent to the right adrenal bed.
